channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Senators from both parties grilled RFK Jr. on vaccines and more
item.description: In a blistering hearing, Senators from both parties challenged the health secretary to defend his actions, including on vaccines access and CDC leader...

item.title: Why the medical community is thrilled by U.S. support for a 'breakthrough' HIV drug
item.description: Lenacapavir has the potential to end the HIV epidemic, researchers say. The Trump administration says backing this kind of effort will be a model for ...

item.title: Experiencing pain? Sanjay Gupta explains why 'It Doesn't Have to Hurt'
item.description: Gupta's new book examines the world of pain — why we feel it, and how we can treat it. He says distraction and meditation can be useful tools for mana...

item.title: The U.S. is designating Ecuador's largest gangs as terrorists
item.description: The U.S. is designating Ecuador's two largest gangs — Los Choneros and Los Lobos — as foreign terrorist organizations.

item.title: For mixed status families, deportation fears cast shadow over new academic year
item.description: As the new school year begins, mixed immigration status families face heightened fears about ICE enforcement near schools, creating anxiety that exten...

item.title: At least 15 killed in funicular rail car crash in Lisbon, Portugal
item.description: The cause of the deadly crash remains unclear after an electric streetcar derailed in Lisbon, Portugal.

item.title: What polls show about Americans’ views on childhood vaccine mandates
Trump-backed plan to redraw Missouri congressional districts draws opposition at first hearing
'Alligator Alcatraz' immigration centre can stay open, appeals court rules
item.description: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis welcomes the ruling and declares the Everglades site "open for business".

item.title: Boy, 3, pulled from funicular crash that has shocked Portugal
item.description: It is unclear what caused the crash in which 16 people died and more than 20 were injured, including many foreign nationals.

item.title: FACT FOCUS: A look at false and misleading claims made by RFK Jr. during Senate hearing
item.description: Kennedy was answering a question from Sen. Maggie Hassan on whether COVID-19 vaccines have saved millions of American lives.

item.title: Sweden accuses Russia of GPS jamming over Baltic Sea
item.description: Interferences to satellite navigational systems occur almost daily, aviation officials say.

item.title: Here's how far mortgage rates have dropped in 2025 (and how much further they can still fall)
item.description: Mortgage interest rates have been falling for much of 2025. Here's how far they've dropped and what to expect next.

item.title: Teen killed and seven injured in mass stabbing in Canada
item.description: Investigators said the 18-year-old killed was the sister of the suspect, who was known to police.

item.title: What we know about Lisbon's deadly funicular crash
item.description: At least 16 people died after a carriage on the city's famous Glória hillside railway derailed.

item.title: Source of "rotten egg" smell identified in Gloucester
item.description: The city of Gloucester says it's identified the source of a "strong odor" that smells like rotten eggs.

item.title: $10,000 CD account moves to make before a September Fed rate cut
item.description: Don't rush into opening a $10,000 CD account this month before considering these three savvy moves.
